title: Gilbert Plains
text:
Gilbert Plains is an unincorporated urban community in the <a href="Gilbert%20Plains%20Municipality">Gilbert Plains Municipality</a>, <a href="Manitoba">Manitoba</a>, <a href="Canada">Canada</a>, that was classified as a <a href="List%20of%20towns%20in%20Manitoba">town</a> prior to January 1, 2015. 
It is situated on the <a href="Valley%20River%20%28Manitoba%29">Valley River</a>, in the <a href="Parkland%20Region">Parkland Region</a> between <a href="Riding%20Mountain%20National%20Park">Riding Mountain National Park</a> and <a href="Duck%20Mountain%20Provincial%20Park%20%28Manitoba%29">Duck Mountain Provincial Park</a>. 
Gilbert Plains was featured during season 3 of the <a href="Canadian%20Broadcasting%20Corporation">CBC</a> program "<a href="Still%20Standing%20%28Canadian%20TV%20series%29">Still Standing</a>". The episode originally aired on September 5, 2017. 
History.
<a href="Municipal%20corporation">Incorporated</a> in 1906, the original townsite was some miles to the south. The community was named for Gilbert Ross, a <a href="M%C3%A9tis%20people%20%28Canada%29">Métis</a> man who was living in the region when the first <a href="European%20ethnic%20groups">European</a> settler, <a href="Glenlyon%20Campbell">Glenlyon Campbell</a>, arrived.
On 1 January 2015, the Town of Gilbert Plains relinquished its town status when it amalgamated with the <a href="Rural%20Municipality%20of%20Gilbert%20Plains">Rural Municipality of Gilbert Plains</a> to form the Gilbert Plains Municipality.
Media.
A local newspaper, "The Exponent", serviced both Gilbert Plains and its neighboring town, <a href="Grandview%2C%20Manitoba">Grandview</a>. "The Exponent" closed on 24 February 2017, after 117 years of operation.
Transportation.
The community is located on <a href="Manitoba%20Provincial%20Highway%205">Highway 5</a> and the <a href="Canadian%20National%20Railway">CN</a> <a href="railway">railway</a> line between <a href="Dauphin%2C%20Manitoba">Dauphin</a> and <a href="Grandview%2C%20Manitoba">Grandview</a>, approximately northwest of <a href="Winnipeg">Winnipeg</a>. <a href="Gilbert%20Plains%20railway%20station">Gilbert Plains railway station</a> receives <a href="Via%20Rail">Via Rail</a> service. The community previously had an <a href="Gilbert%20Plains%20Airport">airport</a>.
